title: Toronto housing prices rise more than what most people in the city make in a year
description: Penelope Graham, managing editor at Zoocasa, joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss a new report that shows the Toronto median house price jumped nearly the equivalent of a year’s salary for an average Torontonian. She talks about what needs to change to help Canadians handle the hot housing market.

title: What's pushed Toronto housing prices higher
description: The average selling price for a home in the Greater Toronto market rose 11.9 per cent in December compared with a year ago. Meanwhile, sales rose 17.4 per cent. Erik Hertzberg of Bloomberg News explains what’s pushed prices higher.

title: Toronto builder waging war on housing price crisis
description: One of Canada's biggest developers has declared war on Toronto's housing affordability problem. Bloomberg News' Natalie Wong has the details.

title: Housing Prices Outpacing Wage Gains, Says Redfin's Richardson
description: May.24 -- Nela Richardson, chief economist at Redfin, discusses the outlook for the U.S. housing market. She speaks on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: London Lags as Housing Prices Fall
description: May.21 -- London housing prices fall while prices in Wales and the rest of England rise. Bloomberg's Lucy Meakin reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Amanda Lang: Regulations may have driven housing prices higher
description: BNN Bloomberg's Amanda Lang discusses a new C.D. Howe report showing how government regulations have impacted housing prices.

title: Canada's housing prices aren't stacking up their weight in gold: Goldmoney
description: Josh Crumb, co-founder and chief strategy officer at Goldmoney, joins BNN's Catherine Murray for his outlook on gold prices and shares why data shows the Canadian home prices and their purchasing parity are not stacking up against gold prices.

title: Housing prices in Vancouver, Toronto continue to rise: BMO
description: BMO's latest report on housing affordability in Canada notes that it remains "very good" across the country except in Vancouver and Toronto. Sal Guatieri, senior economist at BMO Capital Markets, joins BNN to discuss.

title: Fitch warns of risks for Canada’s banks as housing prices remain elevated
description: Doriana Gamboa, senior director at Fitch Ratings, joins BNN's Catherine Murray for a look at why escalating housing prices could signal a red flag on Fitch's ratings for Canada's banks.

title: How Canada's film industry is handling soaring housing prices
description: Valerie Creighton, president and CEO of the Canadian Media Fund, joins BNN for a look at the state of the Canadian film industry as more content shifts online and how it's handling skyrocketing housing prices in film production's major hubs.

title: Manulife CEO: It's not Chinese investors driving Canadian housing prices
description: Growth in Asia continues to be a key driver for Manulife. BNN digs into the company's plans for the region and touch on how other parts of the business are doing. Manulife CEO Don Guloien also offers his thoughts on Canada's real estate market.

title: How a drop in housing prices would hurt the Canadian dollar
description: Adam Button, chief currency analyst at ForexLive discusses how a potential housing price drop would affect the Canadian dollar, and the reaction of the euro after the first round of the French election.

title: MoneyTalk: Growing concerns about Canadian housing prices
description: Michael Craig, senior portfolio manager at TD Asset Management, looks at current real estate trends in Toronto and Vancouver and the broader implications.

title: Rising housing prices aren't due to speculation: Royal LePage CEO
description: Phil Soper, president and CEO of Royal LePage tells BNN why he disagrees with Ontario Finance Minister Charles Sousa's request for a capital gains tax hike. Sousa wants to see the measure in the federal budget to curb real estate speculation.

title: Comparing Toronto housing prices to the market bull run
description: Greg Newman, senior wealth advisor, director and portfolio manager, Newman Group, Scotia Wealth Management discusses how Toronto real estate and the markets share some similarities.

title: Mattamy Homes: Government inaction fuelling Housing price wars
description: Brian Johnston, Chief Operating Officer, Mattamy Homes joins BNN's Catherine Murray for a look at why he believes government inaction in taking faster action to re-zone is potentially fueling more housing bidding wars.

title: The 'wild cards' facing Canadian housing prices
description: Don Campbell, senior analyst at Real Estate Investment Network, weighs in on Canada's housing market and how Trump will impact prices.

title: Billionaire Jim Pattison raises concerns on Vancouver’s high housing prices
description: He may be called Canada’s "under the radar" billionaire, but Jim Pattison is raising his concerns on the effects of high-priced housing and low interest rates. BNN’s Jon Erlichman provides a preview of his interview.

title: Pattie Lovett-Reid: Should Canadians be concerned about high housing prices?
description: Canadians are becoming increasingly worried about the real estate market, according to a new Manulife survey that found that 73 per cent of respondents believe home ownership is unaffordable. CTV’s Chief Financial Commentator Pattie Lovett-Reid has more.

title: Housing prices continue to surge
description: Barry Fenton, President & CEO of Lanterra Developments joins BNN to discuss why he thinks condo prices in Toronto will continue to go higher and why Torontonians should get used to condo living.

title: Hot housing prices spur laneway housing
description: Soaring home prices are encouraging potential buyers to look into new options for home ownership, including garages, more commonly called "laneway housing." Mark McLean, Past President of TREB, Broker at Bosley Real Estate tells BNN why this might be an option for millennials, but how it might take more money than you think.

title: Latest Toronto housing prices signals need for policy change says broker
description: With Toronto home prices pushing into even further rarified territory last month, Walter Melanson, co-founder & lead analyst at PropertyGuys.com joins BNN for a look at why he believes the latest stats out of the hot housing market is a wake up call for policy change from Ottawa.

title: Vancouver housing prices surge 32%
description: Vancouver's hot housing market continues to climb. Kevin O'Leary, Chairman of O'Leary Financial Group joins BNN to discuss why these gains are really not that great for foreign investors buying Canadian real estate.

title: Top investors split on whether Ottawa should try to cool hot housing prices
description: Bay Street is split on whether Ottawa should try to tame the country’s runaway real estate markets. Almost half of portfolio managers and economists surveyed by BNN say Ottawa should resist intervening. BNN’s Jameson Berkow has more.

title: TD sees housing prices rising 1% in 2016
description: Diana Petramala, Real Estate Economist, TD Economics joins BNN to discuss the impact of low interest rates and falling oil on the Canadian housing market, and why she sees only 1% growth in home prices next year.

title: Real Estate Watch: Vancouver faces labour shortage because of housing prices
description: VanCity credit union says millennials are being driven out of the city of Vancouver because they can’t afford to live there. As Greg Bonnell reports, this could have major implications for the labour market.

title: Average housing prices rise in Canada's major cities
description: BNN speaks with Gregory Klump, Chief Economist, Canadian Real Estate Association.
